body:
It seems like this regression has been introduced when the configuration files have been merged.

It's still possible to disable URL launching by setting the `launcher` to `true`, but an option to disable this completely should be supported explicitly.

issue.title: Fix regression in the URL launcher config
issue.body:
Due to the merging of configuration files on all platforms, it has been
made impossible to completely disable URL launching without still
executing some kind of program like `true`.

Setting the launcher to `None` in the config, will now disable it
completely.

This fixes #2058.

body: @joeky888 I'm assuming you mean that when you try to select that sometimes you simply click on accident and it then opens the URL. If you are seeing the URL open when clicking and dragging your cursor over a URL to select, that is a bug, which I cannot reproduce on my machine.

> you simply click on accident

Yeah, that's not a bug.

> Fixed in #2059.

Thanks.

With the version 0.8.0 the `url.launcher` is deprecated, to disable xdg launcher in version 0.8.0:

```yaml
hints:
  enabled:
   - regex: "(ipfs:|ipns:|magnet:|mailto:|gemini:|gopher:|https:|http:|news:|file:|git:|ssh:|ftp:)\
             [^\u0000-\u001F\u007F-\u009F<>\"\\s{-}\\^âŸ¨âŸ©`]+"
     command: xdg-open
     post_processing: true
     mouse:
       enabled: false # ðŸ‘ˆ
       mods: None
```

> With the version 0.8.0 the `url.launcher` is deprecated, to disable xdg launcher in version 0.8.0:
> 
> ```yaml
> hints:
>   enabled:
>    - regex: "(ipfs:|ipns:|magnet:|mailto:|gemini:|gopher:|https:|http:|news:|file:|git:|ssh:|ftp:)\
>              [^\u0000-\u001F\u007F-\u009F<>\"\\s{-}\\^âŸ¨âŸ©`]+"
>      command: xdg-open
>      post_processing: true
>      mouse:
>        enabled: false # ðŸ‘ˆ
>        mods: None
> ```

its working. 
when you hover with the mouse on `git:(master)`, for example, its not a URL anymore. 
yay. thanks man.
Fyi mouse is disabled by default for hints. So you can just remove the entire `mouse` section.

For my fellow Googlers, you can actually have it both ways.

I don't like that URLs open when I double-click them, because that makes them annoying to select for copying. However, I also often want to open URLs in my default browser, so it would be nice to be able to do that as well.

This configuration enables ctrl+click on links to open them using xdg-open:

```
hints:
  enabled:
    - regex: "(ipfs:|ipns:|magnet:|mailto:|gemini:|gopher:|https:|http:|news:|file:|git:|ssh:|ftp:)\
              [^\u0000-\u001F\u007F-\u009F<>\"\\s{-}\\^âŸ¨âŸ©`]+"
      command: xdg-open
      post_processing: true
      mouse:
        enabled: true
        mods: Control
```

And I can now double-click to select.
i can say you are a pro googler

The solutions in this report seem to work for regular links but not for all cases.

When I get certain errors in gcc, there are often hyperlinks included.

Running a hello world without stdio.h will result in:

`warning: implicit declaration of function â€˜printfâ€™ [-Wimplicit-function-declaration]`
where -Wimplicit-function-declaration will be a hyperlink to gcc.gnu.org

No matter how I configure alacritty, it seems impossible to disable the link feature and a single click on the error message will open a browser.

How do I disable ALL hyperlinks in alacritty?
You set the `hyperlinks: false` for the default regex hint?

> You set the hyperlinks: false for the default regex hint?

This seems to be ignored no matter how I set it. 

Here is the config:

```
hints:
  hyperlinks: false

enabled:
   - regex: "(ipfs:|ipns:|magnet:|mailto:|gemini:|gopher:|https:|http:|news:|file:|git:|ssh:|ftp:)\
             [^\u0000-\u001F\u007F-\u009F<>\"\\s{-}\\^âŸ¨âŸ©`]+"
     hyperlinks: false
     command: false
     post_processing: true
     mouse:
       enabled: false
       mods: Control
     binding:
       key: U
       mods: Control|Shift
```

It still executes xdg-open when a link is clicked on.

How does this work in the new Alacritty where it uses TOML instead of Yaml?
The above regex when converted to TOML doesn't load.
